intro: Senecio skottsbergii var. anomalus, commonly known as the anomalous senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
